meanings.definition: In a critical or disparaging manner
meanings.sent1: She dyslogistically commented on his painting, pointing out all its flaws.
meanings.sent2: He dyslogistically criticized the new policy during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat dyslogistically observed the dog's attempt to catch a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered dyslogistically, foretelling a heavy downpour.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dyslogistically marked all the spelling mistakes in the student's essay.

meanings.sent1: Her dyslogistically tone made everyone uncomfortable at the party.
meanings.sent2: The article had a dyslogistically view on the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man gave a dyslogistically thumbs-down to the new restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The dark, dyslogistically clouds loomed over the city, casting a gloomy shadow.
meanings.sent5: The judge's dyslogistically remarks left the defendant feeling dejected.
